creator.name: Wees- en onbeheerde Boedelkamer Curaçao
creator.name_english: Orphans and Ownerless Estates Chamber on Curaçao
creator.his_func: The Orphans Chamber of Curaçao was probably established in 1696. During the 18th century there were usually two orphan masters, sometimes assisted by a clerk and/or a bookkeeper. The orphan masters were entrusted with the supervision of minors and the direction of their estates, and the administration of left or abandoned estates, when it was not clear if there were any heirs. The Orphans Chamber also lent money on mortgage. The introduction of a new body of laws made many of the tasks of the Orphans Chamber regarding orphans and left estates redundant, except its function regarding mortgages. This was taken over by the Curaçaose Hypotheek-, Spaar- en Beleenbank (Curaçao Mortgage Bank). In 1875 the Orphans Chamber was officially dissolved.
creator.Aantekeningen: Relatie met de Curacaose Hypotheek-, Spaar- en Beleenbank. Deze nam in de tweede helft 19e eeuw de functie van hypotheekverstrekker over van de Wees- en Onbeheerde Boedelkamer (zie verslag HJ, mei 2011 en artikel in "Archiefvriend" op foto gezet)
